verses.verse: Save<WH3467> me,<WH430> God, for the waters<WH4325> have come<WH935> up to my neck!<WH5315>
I sink<WH2883> in deep<WH4688> mire,<WH3121> where there is no foothold.<WH4613> I have come<WH935> into deep<WH4615> waters,<WH4325> where the floods<WH7641> overflow me.<WH7857>
I am weary<WH3021> with my crying.<WH7121> My throat<WH1627> is dry.<WH2787> My eyes<WH5869> fail,<WH3615> looking<WH3176> for my God.<WH430>

Those who hate<WH8130> me without a cause<WH2600> are more<WH7231> than the hairs<WH8185> of my head.<WH7218> Those who want to cut me off,<WH6789> being my enemies<WH341> wrongfully,<WH8267> are mighty.<WH6105> I have to restore<WH7725> what I didn't<WH1497> take away.
God,<WH430> you know<WH3045> my foolishness.<WH200> My sins<WH819> aren't<WH3582> hidden from you.

Don't<WH6960> let those who wait for you be shamed<WH954> through me,<WH136> Lord Yahweh<WH3069> of Armies.<WH6635> Don't<WH1245> let those who seek you be brought to dishonor<WH3637> through me,<WH430> God of Israel.<WH3478>
Because for your sake,<WH5375> I have borne reproach.<WH2781> Shame<WH3639> has covered<WH3680> my face.<WH6440>
I have become a stranger<WH2114> to my brothers,<WH251> an alien<WH5237> to my mother<WH517>'s children.<WH1121>
For the zeal<WH7068> of your house<WH1004> consumes<WH398> me.<WH2781> The reproaches of those who reproach<WH2778> you have fallen on me.<WH5307>
When I wept<WH1058> and I<WH5315> fasted,<WH6685> that was to my reproach.<WH2781>
When I made<WH5414> sackcloth<WH8242> my clothing,<WH3830> I became a byword to them.<WH4912>
Those who sit in<WH3427> the gate<WH8179> talk<WH7878> about me.<WH5058> I am the song of the drunkards.<WH8354>

But as for me,<WH8605> my prayer is to you,<WH3068> Yahweh, in an acceptable<WH7522> time.<WH6256> God,<WH430> in the abundance<WH7230> of your loving kindness,<WH2617> answer<WH6030> me in the truth<WH571> of your salvation.<WH3468>
Deliver<WH5337> me out of the mire,<WH2916> and don't<WH2883> let me sink. Let me be delivered<WH5337> from those who hate<WH8130> me,<WH4615> and out of the deep waters.<WH4325>
Don't<WH4325> let the flood waters overwhelm<WH7857> me,<WH4688> neither let the deep swallow me up.<WH1104> Don't<WH875> let the pit shut<WH332> its mouth on me.<WH6310>
Answer<WH6030> me,<WH3068> Yahweh, for your loving kindness<WH2617> is good.<WH2896> According to the multitude<WH7230> of your tender mercies,<WH7356> turn to me.<WH6437>
Don't<WH5641> hide your face<WH6440> from your servant,<WH5650> for I am in distress.<WH6887> Answer<WH6030> me speedily!<WH4118>
Draw near<WH7126> to my soul,<WH5315> and redeem<WH1350> it.<WH6299> Ransom me because of my enemies.<WH341>
You know<WH3045> my reproach,<WH2781> my shame,<WH2781> and my dishonor.<WH1322> My adversaries are all before you.<WH6887>

Reproach<WH2781> has broken<WH7665> my heart,<WH3820> and I am full of heaviness.<WH5136> I looked<WH6960> for some to take pity,<WH5110> but there was none;<WH5162> for comforters, but I found none.<WH4672>
They also gave<WH5414> me gall<WH7219> for my food.<WH1267> In my thirst,<WH6772> they gave me vinegar<WH2558> to drink.<WH8248>
Let their table<WH7979> before<WH6440> them become a snare.<WH6341> May it become a retribution<WH7965> and a trap.<WH4170>
Let their eyes<WH5869> be darkened,<WH2821> so that they can't<WH7200> see. Let their backs<WH4975> be continually<WH8548> bent.<WH4571>
Pour out<WH8210> your indignation<WH2195> on them.<WH2740> Let the fierceness of your anger<WH639> overtake them.<WH5381>
Let their habitation<WH2918> be desolate.<WH8074> Let no one dwell<WH3427> in their tents.<WH168>
For they persecute<WH7291> him whom you have wounded.<WH5221> They tell<WH5608> of the sorrow<WH4341> of those whom you have hurt.<WH2491>
Charge<WH5414> them with crime<WH5771> upon crime.<WH5771> Don't<WH935> let them come into your righteousness.<WH6666>
Let them be blotted<WH4229> out of the book<WH5612> of life,<WH2416> and not be written<WH3789> with the righteous.<WH6662>
But I am in pain<WH6041> and distress.<WH3510> Let your salvation,<WH3444> God,<WH430> protect me.<WH7682>
I will praise<WH1984> the name<WH8034> of God<WH430> with a song,<WH7892> and will magnify<WH1431> him with thanksgiving.<WH8426>
It will please<WH3190> Yahweh<WH3068> better<WH3190> than an ox,<WH7794> or a bull<WH7794> that has horns<WH7160> and hoofs.<WH6536>
The humble<WH6035> have seen<WH7200> it,<WH8055> and are glad. You who seek<WH1875> after God,<WH430> let your heart<WH3824> live.<WH2421>
For Yahweh<WH3068> hears<WH8085> the needy,<WH34> and doesn't<WH959> despise his captive people.<WH615>
Let heaven<WH8064> and earth<WH776> praise<WH1984> him;<WH3220> the seas, and everything that moves therein!<WH7430>
For God<WH430> will save<WH3467> Zion,<WH6726> and build<WH1129> the cities<WH5892> of Judah.<WH3063> They shall settle there, and own it.
The children<WH2233> also of his servants<WH5650> shall inherit<WH5157> it.<WH157> Those who love his name<WH8034> shall dwell therein.<WH7931>
